alert.note: Alert for Macomb (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 26 at 6:51AM EST until January 26 at 12:32PM EST by NWS Detroit
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Detroit/Pontiac MI has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Michigan... Clinton River Near Clinton Township affecting Macomb County. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING TO THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring.!. * WHERE...Clinton River near Clinton Township. * WHEN...From this morning to this afternoon. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:30 AM EST Friday the stage was 16.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to crest this morning and drop back below flood stage later today. - Flood stage is 16.0 feet. - Impact...At 16.0 feet, Some low spots on Millar Road flood. Water reaches the bottoms of the Garfield, Uitca and Hayes Road bridges. Low land flooding increases. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.water.weather.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=DTX. The next statement will be issued this afternoon at 1245 PM EST.
